name: referralTests

variableSet.name: referralTestOrderingDate
day
variableSet.description: Format DD e.g. 12th of October is 12
The date of which the referralTest was sent to Bioinformatics

variableSet.name: tumourSamples
tumourId
variableSet.description: This is the ID of the tumour from which this tumour sample was taken from

variableSet.name: diseaseType
variableSet.description:
Disease type.
        NOTE: Deprecated in GMS

variableSet.name: diseaseSubType
variableSet.description:
Disease subtype.
        NOTE: Deprecated in GMS

variableSet.name: haematologicalCancer
variableSet.description: True or false if this sample is of type: Haematological Cancer

variableSet.name: haematologicalCancerLineage
variableSet.description: This is the Haematological cancer lineage of the tumourSample if this sample is from a haematological cancer

variableSet.name: clinicalSampleDateTime
variableSet.description: The time when the sample was received. In the format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+0000

variableSet.name: tumourType
variableSet.description:
Tumor type.
        NOTE: Deprecated in GMS in tumourSample but available in tumour record

variableSet.name: tumourContentPercentage
variableSet.description: This is the tumour content percentage

variableSet.name: preparationMethod
variableSet.description:
The preparation method of the sample
        NOTE: Deprecated in GMS in replace of Method and storageMedium record

variableSet.name: tissueSource
variableSet.description:
The tissue source of the sample.
        NOTE: DEPRECATED IN GMS in replace of method record

variableSet.name: sampleMorphologies
id
variableSet.description: The ontology term id or accession in OBO format ${ONTOLOGY_ID}:${TERM_ID} (http://www.obofoundry.org/id-policy.html)

variableSet.name: value
variableSet.description:
Optional value for the ontology term, the type of the value is not checked
        (i.e.: we could set the pvalue term to "significant" or to "0.0001")
Morphology according to the sample taken

variableSet.name: sampleTopographies
id
variableSet.description: The ontology term id or accession in OBO format ${ONTOLOGY_ID}:${TERM_ID} (http://www.obofoundry.org/id-policy.html)

variableSet.name: value
variableSet.description:
Optional value for the ontology term, the type of the value is not checked
        (i.e.: we could set the pvalue term to "significant" or to "0.0001")
Topography according to the sample taken

variableSet.name: sampleUid
variableSet.description: In GMS, this is the GUID of the sample

variableSet.name: maskedPid
variableSet.description: In GMS, this is the maskedPID

variableSet.name: method
variableSet.description: In GMS, this is how the sample was extracted from the participant

variableSet.name: storageMedium
variableSet.description: In GMS, this is what solvent/medium the sample was stored in

variableSet.name: sampleType
variableSet.description: In GMS, this is the sampleType as entered by the clinician in TOMs

variableSet.name: sampleState
variableSet.description: In GMS, this is the sampleState as entered by the clinician in TOMs
List of all somatic samples applicable to this test

variableSet.name: germlineSamples
preparationMethod
variableSet.description:
Preparation method
        NOTE: In GMS, this has been deprecated in favour of Method and storageMedium

variableSet.name: clinicalSampleDateTime
variableSet.description: The time when the sample was received. In the format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+0000

variableSet.name: method
variableSet.description: In GMS, this is how the sample was extracted from the participant

variableSet.name: storageMedium
variableSet.description: In GMS, this is what solvent/medium the sample was stored in

variableSet.name: sampleType
variableSet.description: In GMS, this is the sampleType as entered by the clinician in TOMs

variableSet.name: sampleState
variableSet.description: In GMS, this is the sampleState as entered by the clinician in TOMs
List of all germline samples aplicable to this test

variableSet.name: specificDisease
variableSet.description: The specific disease that a panel tests

variableSet.name: interpreter
variableSet.description: Organisation assigned for the interpretation of this test

variableSet.name: processingLab
variableSet.description: Organisation assigned for the processing of the test

variableSet.name: pipelineStartDate
day
variableSet.description: Format DD e.g. 12th of October is 12

Date of ordering. NOTE: this field is not required from upstream
        and will be generated by Bioinformatics when all sample data and all
        required clinical data is received for the first time

variableSet.name: diseasePenetrances
specificDisease
variableSet.description: The disease to which the penetrance applies
Disease Penetrance applied for that referralTest

variableSet.name: matchedSamples
germlineSampleId
variableSet.description: Sample identifier (e.g, LP00012645_5GH)) for the germline

variableSet.name: tumourSampleId
variableSet.description: Sample identifier (e.g, LP00012643_7JS)) for the tumor
List of matched samples (i.e.: pairs tumour-germline)

description: List of tests associated to the referral

variableSet.name: day
variableSet.description: Format DD e.g. 12th of October is 12

variableSet.name: GitVersionControl
variableSet.description: This is the version for the entire set of data models as referred to the Git release tag

variableSet.name: familyId
variableSet.description: Family identifier which internally translate to a sample set

variableSet.name: members
pedigreeId
variableSet.description: Numbering used to refer to each member of the pedigree

variableSet.name: isProband
variableSet.description: If this field is true, the member should be considered the proband of this family

variableSet.name: participantId
variableSet.description: participantId.  This is the human readable ID in GMS

variableSet.name: gelSuperFamilyId
variableSet.description:
superFamily id, this id is built as a concatenation of all
        families id in this superfamily i.e, fam10024_fam100457.
        NOTE: Retired for GMS

variableSet.name: personKaryotypicSex
variableSet.description: Karyotypic sex of the participant as previously established or by looking at the GEL genome

variableSet.name: fatherId
variableSet.description:
refers to the pedigreeId of the father
        Id of the parent, if unknown then no parent is referenced. Parents may need to be entered even if no data is known
        about them in order to unambiguously reconstruct the pedigree.

variableSet.name: motherId
variableSet.description:
refers to the pedigreeId of the mother
        Id of the parent, if unknown then no parent is referenced. Parents may need to be entered even if no data is known
        about them in order to unambiguously reconstruct the pedigree.

variableSet.name: superFatherId
variableSet.description:
this id is built using the original familyId and the original pedigreeId of the father
        NOTE: retired for GMS

variableSet.name: superMotherId
variableSet.description:
this id is built using the original familyId and the original pedigreeId of the mother
        NOTE: Retired for GMS

variableSet.name: twinGroup
variableSet.description: Each twin group is numbered, i.e. all members of a group of multiparous births receive the same number

variableSet.name: monozygotic
variableSet.description: A property of the twinning group but should be entered for all members

variableSet.name: consanguineousParents
variableSet.description: The parents of this participant has a consanguineous relationship

variableSet.name: disorderList
diseaseGroup
variableSet.description: This is Level2 Title for this disorder

variableSet.name: diseaseSubGroup
variableSet.description: This is Level3 Title for this disorder

variableSet.name: specificDisease
variableSet.description:
This is Level4 Title for this disorder.
        In GMS, this is the clinicalIndicationFullName/clinicalIndicationCode.
Clinical Data (disorders). If the family member is unaffected as per affectionStatus then this list is empty.

variableSet.name: termPresence
variableSet.description:
This is whether the term is present in the participant (default is unknown) yes=term is present in participant,
        no=term is not present

variableSet.name: modifiers
variableSet.description: Modifier associated with the HPO term

variableSet.name: ancestries
chiSquare1KGenomesPhase3Pop
chiSquare
variableSet.description: Chi-square test for goodness of fit of this sample to this 1000 Genomes Phase 3 population
Chi-square test for goodness of fit of this sample to 1000 Genomes Phase 3 populations

Participant's ancestries, defined as Mother's/Father's Ethnic Origin and Chi-square test for goodness of fit of this sample to 1000 Genomes Phase 3 populations.
        NOTE: for GMS this field has been deprecated in favour of clinicalEthnicities

variableSet.name: consentStatus
programmeConsent
variableSet.description:
Is this individual consented to the programme?
        It could simply be a family member that is not consented but for whom affection status is known

variableSet.name: primaryFindingConsent
variableSet.description: Consent for feedback of primary findings?

What has this participant consented to?
        A participant that has been consented to the programme should also have sequence data associated with them; however
        this needs to be programmatically checked

variableSet.name: testConsentStatus
programmeConsent
variableSet.description:
Is this individual consented to the programme? It could simply be a family member that is not consented
        but for whom affection status is known

variableSet.name: primaryFindingConsent
variableSet.description:
Consent for feedback of primary findings?
        RD: Primary Findings
        Cancer: PrimaryFindings is somatic + pertinent germline findings

variableSet.name: healthRelatedFindingConsent
variableSet.description: Consent for secondary health related findings?

variableSet.name: pharmacogenomicsFindingConsent
variableSet.description: Consent for pharmacogenomics consent as secondary findings?
What has this participant consented in the context of a Genomic Test?

variableSet.name: samples
preparationMethod
variableSet.description:
Preparation method
        NOTE: In GMS, this has been deprecated in favour of Method and storageMedium

variableSet.name: clinicalSampleDateTime
variableSet.description: The time when the sample was received. In the format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+0000

variableSet.name: method
variableSet.description: In GMS, this is how the sample was extracted from the participant

variableSet.name: storageMedium
variableSet.description: In GMS, this is what solvent/medium the sample was stored in

variableSet.name: sampleType
variableSet.description: In GMS, this is the sampleType as entered by the clinician in TOMs

variableSet.name: sampleState
variableSet.description: In GMS, this is the sampleState as entered by the clinician in TOMs
This is an array containing all the samples that belong to this individual, e.g ["LP00002255_GA4"]

variableSet.name: sampleId
variableSet.description: This is the sample id against which the coefficient was estimated

variableSet.name: program
variableSet.description: Name of program used to calculate the coefficient

variableSet.name: estimationMethod
variableSet.description: Where various methods for estimation exist, which method was used.

variableSet.name: coefficient
variableSet.description: Inbreeding coefficient ideally a real number in [0,1]

variableSet.name: standardError
variableSet.description: Standard error of the Inbreeding coefficient

variableSet.name: additionalInformation
variableSet.description:
We could add a map here to store additional information for example URIs to images, ECGs, etc
        Null by default

variableSet.name: diagnosticDetails
variableSet.description: Additional set of diagnostic ontology terms

variableSet.name: previousTreatment
day
variableSet.description: Format DD e.g. 12th of October is 12
For GMS cases, previous Treatment History
List of members of a pedigree

variableSet.name: specificDisease
variableSet.description: The specific disease that a panel tests

variableSet.name: diseasePenetrances
specificDisease
variableSet.description: The disease to which the penetrance applies
List of disease penetrances. Moved to referralTest for GMS

variableSet.name: readyForAnalysis
variableSet.description: Flag indicating if a pedigree is ready for analysis

variableSet.name: yearOfBirth
variableSet.description: Year of birth for the cancer participant

variableSet.name: morphology
variableSet.description:
Morphology of any tumours
        NOTE: In GMS, this field is deprecated as morphology will be in sample or with respect to a tumour record

variableSet.name: readyForAnalysis
variableSet.description:
Flag indicating if the participant is ready for analysis
        NOTE: In GMS, this will default to true

        It could simply be a family member that is not consented but for whom affection status is known

        A participant that has been consented to the programme should also have sequence data associated with them; however

variableSet.name: participantId
variableSet.description: This is a human readable participant ID

variableSet.name: primaryDiagnosisDisease
variableSet.description:
This should be an enumeration when it is well defined
        blood, breast, prostate, colorectal, cll, aml, renal, ovarian, skin, lymphNode, bone, saliva //for individual - there could be more than I have listed here, in fact there definitely will.
        In GMS, this field is deprecated

variableSet.name: primaryDiagnosisSubDisease
variableSet.description:
This should be an enumeration when it is well defined
        blood, breast, prostate, colorectal, cll, aml, renal, ovarian, skin, lymphNode, bone, saliva //for individual - there could be more than I have listed here, in fact there definitely will.
        In GMS, this field is deprecated
